item.description: On Sunday, Indian skipper Rohit Sharma made history by gambling during the 2d Twenty20 International against Afghanistan in Indore. Rohit additionally owns the file for the most sixes in T20 Internationals, having struck 182.

David Warner arrived to play the match by helicopter: Landing at Sydney Cricket Ground
Former Australian captain David Warner arrived by helicopter to play the Big Bash League (BBL) match. After attending his brother's wedding, he reached the ground by helicopter. His helicopter landed at Sydney Cricket Ground.

item.title: Hardik Pandya plays in T20 World Cup
item.description:
Hardik Pandya plays in T20 World Cup
The question of whether star all-rounder Hardik Pandya will play in this year's T20 World Cup or not is still in the minds of some people. However, there is good news for him because Hardik is recovering rapidly from his ankle injury. He stayed away from the cricket field midway through the ODI World Cup due to injury.

item.description:
Dinesh Karthik will join the coaching staff of England Lions and will be the batting consultant for the India tour
Former Indian wicketkeeper-batsman Dinesh Karthik will join the England A (England Lions) squad for the Indian tour. He will join the team for 9 days and assist in the England Lions preparations.

item.title: Kohli will not play the first T20 against Afghanistan
item.description:
Kohli will not play the first T20 against Afghanistan: Coach Dravid said
Experienced batsman Virat Kohli will not play the first match of the T20 series against Afghanistan. He will be available for the second and third T20. Yashasvi Jaiswal will open the innings with captain Rohit Sharma, while Shubman Gill will bat at number 3 in the absence of Kohli.

item.title: IND Vs AFG 1st T20 today, IND vs AFG: IND vs AFG Dream11 Prediction, Today Match Prediction
item.description:
IND vs AFG: IND vs AFG Dream11 Prediction, Today Match Prediction IND vs AFG, IND Vs AFG 1st T20 today
India (IND) will take on Afghanistan (AFG) in the first T20I of the three-match series on Thursday (January 11) at the Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium in Mohali. This is the first bilateral series between the two teams. They have faced each other three times in the T20 World Cups and once in the Asia Cup. India has won all these four matches.

item.title: Rashid Khan will not play against India
item.description:
Rashid Khan will not play against India: Back injury recovered again, had undergone surgery 2 months ago
Afghanistan's star all-rounder Rashid Khan will not be able to play the T20 series against India. His back injury has recovered again. Rashid had undergone back surgery 2 months ago.

item.title: ICC declared Cape Town pitch unsatisfactory
item.description:
ICC declared Cape Town pitch unsatisfactory
The International Cricket Council (ICC) has given an unsatisfactory rating to the pitch of the match played between India and South Africa at the Newlands ground in Cape Town. Also given one demerit point. The second match of the two-match series between the two teams was played here. This was the shortest Test match in history, which was over in just two days.

item.description:
Virat-Rohit returns to T20 after 14 months: Both are sure to play in T-20 World Cup
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli had not played a single T20 International match in the last 14 months. After the defeat in the semi-finals of the last T20 World Cup, the Indian selectors were giving preference to youth in this format. But now these veterans have returned to the team for the three-match T20 series against Afghanistan starting from January 11.

item.title: Virat Kohli, Pat Cummins nominated for ICC 2023 Player of the Year
item.description: The 2023 Cricketer of the Year candidates were revealed by the International Cricket Council (ICC) on Friday, January 4. Both current Australia captain Pat Cummins and former captain of India, Virat Kohli, are on the list. Together, they had a successful 2023. Virat took home the Player of the Tournament award in the ODI World Cup, while Cummins contributed to Australia's victory. Following an incredible year, Travis Head and Ravindra Jadeja have also been shortlisted.

item.description: Although Rohit and Kohli haven't played for India in the shortest format since November 2022, legendary Indian batsman Vijay Gavaskar supported their selection in the T20 World Cup, which is being held in the USA and the West Indies this year.

item.title: Warner's baggy green cap found
item.description:
Warner's baggy green cap found: It was stolen four days ago before the last Test of Australia-Pak in Sydney.
Warner is playing the last Test match of his international career in Sydney.
Australia opener David Warner's baggy green cap has been received before the end of the last Test. Warner had lost his green cap in Sydney four days ago. He had requested for return. Warner's baggy green cap was found in the team hotel. However, no one knows how he reached there. Warner posted a video on Instagram on Friday morning informing him about getting the baggy green cap. While posting the video, he wrote – Thanks to the people involved in the search.

item.title: ICC Test rankings: Number one crown snatched from India
item.description:
Despite victory in Cape Town, number one crown snatched from India in ICC Test rankings
Under the captaincy of Rohit Sharma, Team India has recently created history by winning the Test match against South Africa in Cape Town. The Indian team has not only become the first team in Asia to win a Test match in Cape Town but has also succeeded in drawing a Test series for the second time on South African soil.

item.title: World's shortest test match: India won by 7 wickets
item.description:
World's shortest test match: India won by 7 wickets
India defeated South Africa by 7 wickets in the second test. Both the teams could bat only 107 overs including 4 innings. This was the shortest match in 147 years of Test history, which yielded a result. Rohit Sharma became the fourth Indian captain to win a Test in South Africa.

item.title: India reaches first position in WTC points table after South Africa Test
item.description:
India reaches first position in WTC points table after South Africa Test
Now the challenge of 5 tests against England, series in Australia is also important
After drawing the series against South Africa, the Indian cricket team has reached the first position in the WTC i.e. World Test Championship. From here the Indian team's mission WTC 2025 has gained momentum. After the tour of West Indies and South Africa, the team now has to play a 5-Test series against England at home. At the same time, the team also has to tour Australia in November-December. These two tours are important for India. Including these two series, India will play a total of 10 tests.

item.title: India won the second test: Shreyas hit the winning shot, match ended in 2 days
item.description:
India won the second test: Shreyas hit the winning shot, match ended in 2 days
For the 25th time in 147 years, the match was over in 2 days; India's third such match, all three won
The test match played between India and South Africa in Cape Town ended in just 2 days. Indian team defeated South Africa by 7 wickets.

item.title: Sri Lanka announced new test captain: Dhananjay de Silva
item.description:
Sri Lanka announced new test captain: Dhananjay de Silva got the responsibility in place of Dimuth Karunaratne.
Dhananjay de Silva has a test match series against Afghanistan in February as captain.
After T20 and ODI, Sri Lanka Cricket has also changed the captain of the Test team. Dhananjay de Silva has been given the command of the Test team in place of Dimuth Karunaratne. Sri Lankan cricket team's chief selector Upul Tharanga has confirmed the change of captain of the Test team.

item.title: Kohli returns to top-10 in Test rankings
item.description:

Indian batsman Virat Kohli has returned to the top-10 in the ICC Test batting rankings. He is one place behind Shubman Gill in the ODI rankings.

item.title: 23 wickets fell on the first day of the second test
item.description:
23 wickets fell on the first day of the second test
 South Africa 55, India all out at 153; Team India still ahead by 36 runs
23 wickets fell on the first day of the second Test being played between India and South Africa. The fast bowlers of both the teams took all the wickets. South Africa won the toss and chose to bat first at the Newlands Stadium in Cape Town, but the team was all out for 55 runs. Mohammad Siraj took 6 wickets from India.

item.title: South Africa all out for 55 runs: Lowest score against India
item.description:
South Africa all out for 55 runs: Lowest score against India, could not even play 24 overs; 6 wickets for Siraj
In the first innings of the second test, South Africa were all out for 55 runs. The team was out on its lowest score against India. South Africa could bat only 23.2 overs at the Newlands Stadium in Cape Town. Fast bowler Mohammad Siraj from India took 6 wickets.

Team India reached Cape Town for the second test
item.description:
Team India reached Cape Town for the second test: Siraj wished everyone a Happy New Year
The Indian team has reached Cape Town to play its last Test match on the South Africa tour. Team India has to play the second and last Test match of the tour here from January 3.
After reaching Cape Town, Indian fast bowler Mohammad Siraj wished everyone a happy new year. The video of the Indian team's arrival in Cape Town has been posted by BCCI from the official social media handle. In which all the players and support staff members are seen descending from the airport. In this video, Siraj is the only player who is seen saying something. While wishing a happy new year, Siraj said that see you on 3rd January.

Notably, fast bowler Mohammad Siraj took a moment to wish everyone a happy new year, expressing enthusiasm for the upcoming match.

item.title: India's WTC Hopes Broken: Penalized and Plummeting After Centurion Collapse!
item.description:
Setback in Centurion: India Penalized for Slow Over-Rate
In a shocking turn of events at Centurion, Team India faces a major setback as they are penalized for a slow over-rate during the first Test against South Africa in the ongoing ICC World Test Championship (WTC). The International Cricket Council (ICC) delivers a blow by docking two crucial WTC points and imposing a hefty 10 percent match fee fine on every player for their failure to maintain the required over-rate.

item.title: India Suffers Defeat Against South Africa in First Test Match
item.description: In a mind-blowing turn of occasions, India confronted a humiliating defeat within the beginning Test healthy against South Africa on Thursday (Dec 28) in Centurion, conceding victory to the Proteas using an innings and 32 runs. The match concluded with India succumbing in their 2nd innings, being bowled out for a mere 131, trailing using 163 runs from the first innings. While Virat Kohli established resilience with a commendable 76 runs within the second innings, the onslaught from Nandre Burger (33/4) and Kagiso Rabada (32/2) proved to be an impressive mission, main to India's downfall.

item.title: IND vs SA:Tests won in Africa, but series yet to be won
item.description:
Tests won in Africa, but series yet to be won: Eye on first Test series win in South Africa
India has to play 2 test matches on South Africa tour.
Indian team these days. On tour to Africa. After T20 and ODI, now it is the turn of 'Test'. This two-Test series is an opportunity in which history can either change, or it can remain intact. Like every African tour, this time too India is looking for its first Test series win in Africa. It is not that it has been difficult for India to win matches in Africa, but the real battle has been to capture the series. India won at least one Test in 4 of the last five African Test tours, but lost the series four times, while once the affair ended in a draw. However, this time the team definitely has some questions before the Boxing Day Test-

item.title: Dhoni will be completely fit before IPL 2024

CSK CEO Kashi Vishwanathan has given an update regarding the fitness of Mahendra Singh Dhoni. Dhoni said at the launch of Junior Super Kings event in Chennai that Dhoni will be completely fit before IPL2024. Dhoni is rehabbing. He will start practicing in the nets in 10 days.

Starc's remarkable feat surpassed the earlier record held by Pat Cummins, who was bagged by Sunrisers Hyderabad for a staggering 20.5 crores.

item.title: IPL 2024 Mega Bids: Pat Cummins Breaks the Bank at 20.5 Cr, Steve Smith Stunned
item.description:
IPL 2024 Mega Bids: Pat Cummins Breaks the Bank at 20.5 Cr, Steve Smith Stunned
Dubai, the pulsating host city for the IPL 2024 Auction, witnessed an electrifying showdown as 332 players vied for the coveted 77 spots across the eight franchises. The auction floor was a melting pot of aspirations, jubilations, and heartbreaks. Pat Cummins emerged as the highest-paid player in IPL history, fetching a staggering 20.5 crores with the Sunrisers Hyderabad.

item.title: WitnesIPL Auction 2024 s Historic Deal as SRH Acquires Pat Cummins for Record-Breaking 20.5 Crores
item.description: In a stunning turn of events at the IPL Auction 2024, the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) have secured the services of Australian pacer Pat Cummins for a jaw-dropping 20 crores and 50 lakhs, making him the highest-paid player in the history of the Indian Premier League (IPL) to date. This colossal deal has shattered all previous records, eclipsing the 18.50 crores paid for Sam Curran in the earlier editions of the tournament.

This time there will be bidding on 333 players, out of which only a maximum of 77 players can be bought. Of these, 30 slots are for foreign players.

India defeated South Africa by 8 wickets in the first ODI. Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan together took 9 wickets in Johannesburg. Debutant Sai Sudarshan took the team to victory by scoring a fifty. Shreyas Iyer from India also scored 52 runs.

item.description:

Deepak Chahar, who is included in the ODI team, will not play ODI due to a family medical emergency. However, BCCI has not given information about what an emergency is. At present, Akash Deep has been included in the team in place of Chahar.

item.description:
Shami may be out of South Africa Test series: Doubt over playing due to injury
There is doubt over Team India's fast bowler Mohammed Shami playing in the Test series against South Africa. According to the report of Cricbuzz, Shami is suffering from ankle injury and he may be out of the series. The first match of the 2 test match series will be played from 26th December.

item.description:

Host South Africa won the second match of the T-20 series against India by 5 wickets. On Tuesday, at the St. George Stadium in Kebera, the African team got a revised target of 152 runs in 15 overs under the DLS method, which the African batsmen achieved by losing 5 wickets in just 13.5 overs. Earlier, Team India, after losing the toss and batting first, scored 180 runs for 7 wickets in 19.3 overs.

Team India left for the South Africa tour on Wednesday morning. Chief coach Rahul Dravid, batting coach Vikram Rathod and his support staff have also accompanied the team. On the South Africa tour, the Indian team has to play a series of first three T20s, then three ODIs and finally two Test matches.

item.description:
Three captains of India on South Africa tour: Surya T20, KL Rahul ODI, and Rohit Sharma will take charge of the Test team.
The Indian team has been announced in all three formats for the South Africa tour. In each format, a different captain will command the team. Suryakumar Yadav will captain in T-20, KL Rahul in ODI, and Rohit Sharma in Test.

The South Africa team has been announced for the three-format series against India to be played from December 10. Aidan Markram will captain in ODI and T-20 and Temba Bavuma will captain in Test.

item.description:

item.title: India won the T-20 series 4-1: Beat Australia by 6 runs in the 5th match; Mukesh Kumar took 3 wicket
item.description:
India won the T-20 series 4-1: Beat Australia by 6 runs in the 5th match; Mukesh Kumar took 3 wickets
India defeated Australia by 6 runs in the thrilling 5th T20 match. Team India's Arshdeep Singh defended 10 runs in the last 6 balls in Bengaluru. He did not give any runs on the first 3 balls and also took the wicket of captain Matthew Wade. The Kangaroo team could score only 3 runs and lost the match. With the victory in the 5th T20, Team India won the series by a margin of 4-1.

The IPL 2024 auction will take place on December 19 in Dubai. This will be the first time that the IPL auction is being held outside the country. IPL administration has given this information on social media. This time, compared to last year, teams will have Rs 5 crore more to buy players.

item.title: Bangladesh defeated New Zealand in the test by 150 runs: lost for the second time in 24 months
item.description:
Bangladesh defeated New Zealand in the test by 150 runs: lost for the second time in 24 months, Taijul Islam took 6 wickets Bangladesh defeated New Zealand by 150 runs in the first match of the two-Test series. This is Bangladesh's first win against New Zealand at home in Test history.
On Saturday in Sylhet, New Zealand started playing with a score of 113/7. The team was all out for 181 runs and Bangladesh succeeded in winning the Test match against New Zealand for the second time in the last 24 months. Before this, the last time Bangladesh had defeated New Zealand at home by 8 wickets early last year. The two-Test series played in New Zealand was a 1-1 draw.

item.description:

On the basis of Glenn Maxwell's century, Australia defeated India by 5 wickets in the third match of the T-20 series. With this the team has made a comeback 2-1 in the 5-match series. The fourth match of the series will be played in Raipur on December 1.

item.title: Shubman Gill Takes the Helm as Gujarat Titans Captain For IPL 2024
item.description: In a strategic flow for the upcoming season of the Indian Premier League (IPL), Gujarat Titans have officially appointed Shubman Gill as their captain. This announcement comes on the heels of the transfer of the authentic skipper, Hardik Pandya, to the Mumbai Indians. The 2022 champions are gearing up for any other compelling season beneath the leadership of the younger and dynamic cricketer.

item.description: Renowned Sri Lankan off-spinner, Muttiah Muralitharan, has expressed robust support for Rohit Sharma's inclusion in the approaching 2024 T20 World Cup, slated to spread in the dynamic cricketing places of the West Indies and the United States. Despite speculation surrounding Rohit's destiny in T20 Internationals following India's unfulfilled quest for the 2023 World Cup, the 51-year-vintage cricketing legend emphasizes the importance of Rohit Sharma's participation in the approaching match.

item.title: India's biggest run chase against Australia in T-20
item.description:
India's biggest run chase against Australia in T-20: Surya is the Indian captain who scored the most runs in the first match. India achieved a thrilling 2-wicket victory over Australia in the first match of the T-20 series. With this victory, the team has taken a 1-0 lead in the 5-match series. The second match of the series will be played on 26 November in Thiruvananthapuram.
On Thursday in Visakhapatnam, Indian batsmen achieved the target of 209 runs by losing 8 wickets in the last ball of the 20th over. Captain Suryakumar Yadav played an inning of 80 runs on 42 balls, while Ishan Kishan scored 58 runs. Many interesting facts and records were seen during this match.

Rohit Sharma will not play T-20 International: Report claims conversation with Chief Selector Agarkar; Will not play after T-20 World Cup
Indian Captain Rohit Sharma will no longer play in T-20 International. It has been claimed in Media Buddh that Rohit had already discussed this matter with Chief Selector Ajit Agarkar even before the World Cup.

item.title: Will Rohit-Virat not play in the World Cup now, Sharma will be 40, Kohli 39 by 2027
item.description:
Will Rohit-Virat not play in the World Cup now?; Sharma will be 40, Kohli 39 by 2027
For Indian fans, the dream of winning the Cricket World Cup still remains a dream. After 12 years, the team made it to the finals but Australia made the wait longer to win the trophy. Captain Rohit Sharma and experienced Virat Kohli tried their best but could not make the team champion.

item.title: T20 team announced against Australia: Surya captain, Samson no chance; 3 players of World Cup squad
item.description:
T20 team announced against Australia: Surya captain, Samson no chance; 3 players of World Cup squad included
The Indian team has been announced for the 5 T-20 match series against Australia. Suryakumar Yadav has been made the captain of this young team, while experienced wicketkeeper-batsman Sanju Samson has not got a chance.

item.title: ICC announced the World Cup Team of the Tournament: 6 Indians in the list of 12 players
item.description:
ICC announced the World Cup Team of the Tournament: 6 Indians in the list of 12 players, Rohit captain; 2 Australian players included
The International Cricket Council (ICC) has announced the 'Team of the Tournament' for the World Cup 2023. The captain of this team is Rohit Sharma, who made his team win 10 consecutive matches in this tournament. Maximum 6 Indian players are included in this list.

item.title: PM Modi hugged Shami in the dressing room and encouraged the players after the defeat
item.description:
PM Modi hugged Shami in the dressing room and encouraged the players after the defeat; Jadeja-Shami posted photos
The final match of the World Cup 2023 was played between India and Australia on Sunday. In this match, Australia defeated India by six wickets and became world champion for the sixth time. After the defeat in the final, Prime Minister Narendra Modi reached the dressing room of Team India. There he was seen encouraging the players. During this he also hugged Shami. Team's fast bowler Mohammed Shami and star all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja have shared the photo of this meeting.

item.title: Fear of defeat defeated India again: Played 10 ICC tournaments since 2013, lost final-semi-final
item.description:
Fear of defeat defeated India again: Played 10 ICC tournaments since 2013, lost final-semi-final for the 9th time Team India once again lost the chance to win the ICC trophy. Australia defeated India by 7 wickets in the World Cup final played at Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Sunday.
This is the 9th time since 2013 that the Indian team has lost the chance to win the title by losing the semi-final or final match.

item.title: Australia won the ODI World Cup for the sixth time: Beat India by 6 wickets in the final
item.description:
Australia won the ODI World Cup for the sixth time: Beat India by 6 wickets in the final, Travis Head scored 137 runs on 120 balls. Team India has lost only the final match in this World Cup. Before this, the team won 10 consecutive matches. Australian captain Pat Cummins won the toss and decided to bowl first. India has suffered a crushing defeat by 6 wickets in the final of the World Cup 2023. On Sunday, Australia won the ODI World Cup title for the sixth time. This defeat reminded Indian fans of the 2003 World Cup final. 20 years ago the Kangaroos beat us by 125 runs in Johannesburg.
After losing the toss and batting first, Team India was all out for 240 runs at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. Australian batsmen achieved the target of 241 runs by losing 4 wickets in 43 overs. Travis Head scored a century of 137 runs, while Marnus Labuschagne scored an unbeaten 58 runs. Earlier, Mitchell Starc took 3 wickets, while captain Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood got 2 wickets each.

item.title: Pritam-Amit Mishra will perform at the World Cup 2023 closing ceremony. The closing ceremony of the
item.description:
Pritam-Amit Mishra will perform at the World Cup 2023 closing ceremony.
The closing ceremony of the ODI World Cup 2023 will take place on Sunday itself, the day of the final match. The ceremony programs will be held in four stages. Which will take place in the pre-match, drinks break of the first innings, innings break and drinks break of the second innings. Many artists including Bollywood composer-singer Pritam, Amit Mishra will perform in it.

item.title: Indian Team Wants To Win World Cup 2023 For Rahul Dravid
item.description: Indian Cricket Team Captain Rohit Sharma dedicated the team's success to the head coach Rahul Dravid for his approach of giving every player individual liberty to play their own game. In every challenging moment, David gives great support to every player.

item.title: ICC invites all champion captains to the World Cup final
item.description:
ICC invites all champion captains to the World Cup final
The International Cricket Council (ICC) has invited all the previous World Cup champion captains (from 1975 to 2019) for the ODI World Cup 2023 final match. Imran Khan, who made neighboring country Pakistan win the World Cup in 1992, is in jail. In such a situation, it is impossible for him to come. Now it remains to be seen whether captain Arjun Ranatunga, who made Sri Lanka the champion in 1996, will come or not.

item.title: Australia in the World Cup final for the 8th time: match against India on 19 November
item.description:
Australia in the World Cup final for the 8th time: match against India on 19 November
Australia defeated South Africa by 3 wickets in the second semi-final played at Eden Gardens Ground in Kolkata. The Australian team has reached the final of this tournament for the 8th time. At the same time, South Africa once again proved to be a chokers team in a big tournament. This is the fifth time that the African team has lost in the semi-finals of the ODI World Cup.

item.title: SA Vs AUS Dream11 Prediction, Today Match Prediction SA Vs AUS World Cup 2023
item.description:
SA Vs AUS Dream11 Prediction, Today Match Prediction SA Vs AUS World Cup 2023
Welcome to the pinnacle of cricketing excitement as the ICC World Cup 2023 reaches its knockout stage. Brace yourselves for an epic showdown in Semi Final 2, where cricketing powerhouses Australia and South Africa will clash on the revered grounds of Eden Gardens on 16th November 2023.

item.title: World Cup 2023: Won semi-final after 12 years, Virat's first century in knockout
item.description:
World Cup 2023: Won semi-final after 12 years, Virat's first century in knockout
10th consecutive win for the first time in the World Cup. New Zealand defeated in the semi-finals for the first time. Win after two consecutive defeats in the semis.

item.title: Virat has the most centuries in ODI cricket; Broke Sachin's record by scoring 50th century
item.description:
Virat has the most centuries in ODI cricket; Broke Sachin's record by scoring 50th century
Virat Kohli played an inning of 117 runs off 113 balls. He scored the 50th century of his ODI career. He became the batsman with the most centuries in ODIs. Virat broke Sachin Tendulkar's record of 49 centuries. On the other hand, Shreyas Iyer scored 105 runs on 70 balls. Iyer scored his second consecutive century in the World Cup. Shubman Gill scored 80 runs on 66 balls and captain Rohit Sharma scored 47 runs on 29 balls. Tim Southee took 2 wickets for New Zealand.

item.title: World Cup 2023 Semi-Final-1 today: India and New Zealand will face each other in the second consecut
item.description:
World Cup 2023 Semi-Final-1 today: India and New Zealand will face each other in the second consecutive knockout
The first semi-final match of ODI World Cup 2023 will be held today i.e. on 15th November in Mumbai. The match will be played between table-topper India and 2019 runner-up New Zealand. The match will start at 2:00 pm at Wankhede Stadium, with the toss taking place at 1:30 pm.

item.title: IND Vs NZ Dream11 Prediction, Today Match Prediction IND Vs NZ World Cup 2023
item.description:
IND Vs NZ Dream11 Prediction, Today Match Prediction IND Vs NZ World Cup 2023
The first Semi-Final game of the ICC World Cup 2023 will see the clash between India and New Zealand on the 15th of November at the Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai. Both teams played 9 games in the tournament’s league stage. India won all of their 9 games in the tournament, and ended the league stage at the top of the points table, with 18 points to their tally and a net run rate of +2.570. They won their last game against the Netherlands by 160 runs.

item.title: How can India beat New Zealand: Rachin, Boult and Santner are big threats
item.description:
How can India beat New Zealand: Rachin, Boult and Santner are big threats
The first semi-final of the ODI World Cup 2023 between India and New Zealand will be played on Wednesday, November 15. In this World Cup, India has defeated New Zealand in the league match, but facing the Kiwi team at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai will be a completely different challenge.

item.title: Rahul is the Indian who scored the fastest century in the World Cup
item.description:
Rahul is the Indian who scored the fastest century in the World Cup: Rohit scored the most sixes, Kohli scored 50+ for the 7th time.
India's winning campaign continues in the World Cup 2023. The team defeated Netherlands by 160 runs in the last league match on Sunday. The Indian team has achieved its ninth consecutive win in this tournament. For the first time in World Cup history, Team India has won nine consecutive matches in a season.

item.title: India's 9th consecutive win in the World Cup: Beat Netherlands by 160 runs, Iyer-Rahul's centuries
item.description:
India's 9th consecutive win in the World Cup: Beat Netherlands by 160 runs, Iyer-Rahul's centuries
India continues its winning campaign in the World Cup 2023. The team defeated Netherlands by 160 runs in the last league match. This is India's ninth consecutive victory in the World Cup. For the first time, Team India has won nine consecutive matches in a World Cup.

item.description:
What will happen if the semi-finals are washed out in the rain: The match will be held on the reserve day

India will face Netherlands in the ODI World Cup 2023 today on the occasion of Diwali. The match will start at 2:00 PM at M Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru, the toss will take place at 1:30 PM. Both teams will play the 45th and last match of the league stage.

Although Pakistan got the better of England in the last edition of the quadrennial spectacle, they haven’t had the best of times in the bilaterals afterward, which could mean a really competitive contest between these two countries on November 11.

item.title: France Cricket Has Been Accused Of Fraud And Corruption
item.description: France Cricket has been accused of allegations of fraud and corruption, including a potential investigation by The International Cricket Council (ICC). The ICC Team said to the media, "We're looking into it," in response to a report in the French press, which asserted that France Cricket has significantly exaggerated claims about the conduct of matches. The report alleges that France Cricket has been involved in the fabrication of matches and has submitted falsified information to the ICC."

item.title: IND vs. AUS: Ashwin played his first ODI match on his home ground in 6 years
item.description:
Although the 37-year-old could not deliver a stellar performance, the renowned cricketer was happy with his performance in Mohali.
First, it was Mohammed Shami and then Shubman Gill along with Ruturaj Gaikwad grabbed the headlines. Nevertheless, Ravichandran Ashwin's name became the talk of the town after both innings of the opening ODI series between India and Australia at the Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium, Mohali on Friday.

item.title: IND vs AUS 1st ODI: India won by 5 wickets, 1-0 lead in three-match series
item.description:
SKY finally showed what he could do in the ODI by scoring 50 off 49 balls, his 80-run partnership with Rahul brought India closer to a big win.
Mohammed Shami produced a career-best performance of 5-51 as India's frontline batsmen cruised to a five-wicket win against Australia in the opening ODI on Friday. Australia, who came to bat first, were all out for 276 runs in exactly 50 overs, although 300 runs seemed within their reach before Shami was out. In reply, four of India's top six batsmen scored half-centuries as the home team, which had rested several frontline players, won with eight balls to spare.

Mohammed Siraj regained the number 1 position in the ODI rankings
item.description:
Mohammed Siraj regained the number 1 position in the ODI rankings after his brilliant performance in the Asia Cup final
After his stellar performance in the Asia Cup final against Sri Lanka, Indian fast bowler Mohammed Siraj has climbed eight places to the top spot in the ODI bowlers' rankings ahead of the ICC World Cup. His exceptional performance in the spell, where he took 6 for 21 and bowled out Sri Lanka for only 50 runs, catapulted him to the number one spot. Siraj had lost the top spot in March this year but now he has overtaken star bowlers like Trent Boult, Rashid Khan, and Mitchell Starc.

item.title: After Chahal, his wife Dhanashree shared a 'serious note' at the Asia Cup
item.description:
Chahal later responded to the ex-wife with a positive post, but his wife Dhanashree Verma shared a "serious note" on Instagram, taking a dig at the insult.
Yuzvendra Chahal was dropped from India's 17-member Asia Cup squad announced by BCCI chief selector Ajit Agarkar in the presence of skipper Rohit Sharma in New Delhi on Monday. Since the start of 2021, only five bowlers have appeared in more than 15 ODIs for India - Shardul Thakur, Kuldeep Yadav, Mohammed Siraj, Hardik Pandya and Chahal. And while the other four made it to the Asia Cup squad, Chahal was dropped, leading to social media and some veterans left disappointed with the call. Chahal later replied to the ex-wife with a positive post, but his wife Dhanashree Verma shared a "serious note" on Instagram, taking a dig at the insult.

item.title: India's eyes are on Jasprit Bumrah. Will captain Jasprit Bumrah be able to win this series?
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah gave an interesting answer about Rohit Sharma and head coach Rahul Dravid's expectations of him.
Jasprit Bumrah is fit, sharp, and ready to take on the world, but of course, with a sense of caution. He is returning to international cricket after 11 months. He tried to make a comeback in the T20 series against Australia in September last year but was dropped after playing just two matches. He scored another try this year during the home ODI against Sri Lanka but was dropped from the team before the series started. However, this time, Bumrah "will not back down". And he did not do so in his first press conference after returning to the Indian side.

item.title: Sachin Tendulkar's reaction to Virat Kohli after the Indian star scored his 76th century
item.description: India's star batsman Virat Kohli completed his 29th Test century during the final Test against West Indies on Friday. Kohli ended a nearly five-year wait for an overseas Test century by scoring his last century in Perth in December 2018. It was Kohli's 76th international century overall as he moved closer to Sachin Tendulkar's incredible 100 tons. And as he reached his hundred, the 34-year-old star batsman was praised by the Master Blaster himself.

item.title: Kohli kisses wedding ring after century: Run out by Joseph direct throw

On the second day, Virat Kohli scored a century from India, he celebrated the century by kissing his wedding room and bowing to the audience. He was run out for the third time in his Test career due to a direct hit by Alzarri Joseph.

Kohli, playing his 500th international match, returned not out after scoring 87 runs. He became the 5th batsman to score the most runs in international cricket. He left behind Jacques Kallis.

Virat Kohli, playing 500th international match, played a half-century innings, he remained not out after scoring 87 runs. Ravindra Jadeja remained not out after scoring 36 runs with him.

item.title: World Cup 2023: Starting with England-New Zealand match on October 5
item.description:
World Cup 2023: Starting with England-New Zealand match on October 5; India-Pak match in World Cup on October 15
48 matches of ODI World Cup will be played in India for 46 days between October-November. The International Cricket Council (ICC) released the World Cup schedule on Tuesday. item.title: IPL 2023: RCB vs GT, Gujarat Titans won the match by 6 wickets, Bangalore out of playoffs
item.description:
IPL 2023: RCB vs GT, Gujarat Titans won the match by 6 wickets, Bangalore out of playoffs
In the 70th match of the Indian Premier League, Gujarat Titans defeated Royal Challengers Bangalore by 6 wickets and showed the way out of the playoffs. Shubman Gill also scored a century for Gujarat in the match and this was also his second consecutive century. Batting first after losing the toss in the match, they scored 197/5 in 20 overs and Gujarat achieved the target of 198 runs given by RCB in the last over itself. Shubman Gill played an unbeaten inning of 104 runs in 52 balls. With the defeat in this match, RCB's dream of winning the IPL trophy has been shattered once again. For the last 15 years, Bangalore has been waiting to win the IPL trophy and this time too it missed out on the title.

item.title: Dhoni indicated retirement from IPL last two matches
item.description:

Chennai Super Kings defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by 49 runs at their home ground Kolkata's Eden Gardens on Sunday. This could be Dhoni's last season in IPL. Dhoni has been indicating this for two consecutive matches. After the win against Hyderabad in the first home ground, said that he is enjoying the last phase of his career. At the same time, expressed gratitude to the fans who came to support CSK in Kolkata and said that they are trying to bid farewell.

item.title: God of cricket completed half century of age
item.description:
God of cricket completed half century of age
Sachin birthday today: Sachin Tendulkar has completed half century of his life today. He has turned 50 today. Sachin made his international debut on 15 November 1989 against Pakistan. The last match was played against West Indies on 16 November 2013. His career spanned 24 years and 1 day. During this he played a total of 664 matches and scored 34,357 runs.

item.title: CSK beat KKR by 49 runs at Eden Gardens, top the points table
item.description: Chennai Super Kings defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by 49 runs in the 33rd match of IPL 2023 at Eden Gardens, Kolkata on Sunday. Chasing a target of 236, KKR reached 186/8 in 20 overs despite half-centuries from Jason Roy (61) and Rinku Singh (53*). Meanwhile, Mahesh Thekshana and Tushar Deshpande picked up two wickets each for CSK. Initially, CSK reached 235/4 in 20 overs, riding on Rahane's 29-ball 71 half-centuries, studded with six fours and five sixes, helped CSK thrash KKR. Meanwhile, Conway scored 56 off 40 balls, including four fours and three sixes. Dube was also in excellent form as he scored 50 off 21 balls, hitting two fours and five sixes. For CSK's bowling department, Kulwant Khejroliya took two wickets, and Suyash Sharma and Varun Chakraborty took one wicket each.

item.title: Punjab Kings beat Mumbai Indians by 13 runs
item.description: Curran's 55, and Arshdeep's 4-rs7 take Punjab Kings to a 13-run win against Mumbai Indians. Punjab Kings have been set a target of 215 runs vs Mumbai Indians in Match 31 of IPL 2023, at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai on Saturday. A quickfire 55 off 29 balls by Sam Curran helped PBKS reach 214/8 in 20 overs. Meanwhile, Harpreet Singh Bhatia and Jitesh Sharma also played crucial innings. Harpreet scored 41 runs in 28 balls and Jitesh scored 25 runs in 7 balls. For MI's bowling department, Cameron Green and Piyush Chawla took two wickets each, and Arjun Tendulkar, Jason Behrendorff, and Jofra Archer took one wicket each.

item.description:
IPL 2023: Can CSK Defeat LSG in Their Home Ground after 4 Years?
Chennai Super Kings (CSK) will finally return to their home ground, MA Chidambaram Stadium (Chepauk Stadium), after a gap of 4 years to take on Lucknow SuperGiants (LSG) in the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL) on Monday. The much-awaited clash will commence at 7:30 pm, with both teams geared up for an exciting encounter.
Pitch Report and Weather Conditions
The Chepauk Stadium is known for its spinning tracks, making it challenging for batters to score runs freely. The captain who wins the toss would prefer to bowl first to make the most of the conditions. The temperature in Chennai will range between 28-33 degrees Celsius, with no chance of rain, ensuring a full match with no interruptions.

item.title: Royal Challengers Bangalore defeated Mumbai Indians by 9 wickets
item.description: Royal Challengers Bangalore defeated Mumbai Indians by 8 wickets and 22 balls. RCB won the toss and decided to bowl first. Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis (caption) got Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) off to a flying start. Tilak Varma single-handedly guided Mumbai Indians (MI) to 171/7 in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2023 clash in Bengaluru. T Verma had returned unbeaten on 84 off 46 balls, which included nine 4s and four 6s, and stitched a crucial partnership with Nehal Wadhela (21 off 13) and Arshad Khan (15* off 9). Meanwhile, RCB quick Reece Topley injured his shoulder after he put in a dive and was forced to leave the field.

IPL 2023: Joe Root's surprising comments on Ravi Ashwin have everyone talking
item.description:
IPL 2023: Joe Root's surprising comments on Ravi Ashwin have everyone talking
Joe Root, the England Test cricket captain, recently shared his thoughts on the upcoming Indian Premier League (IPL) season and the Rajasthan Royals (RR) team ahead of his maiden IPL stint. Speaking highly of the RR captain, Sanju Samson, Root believes that the young captain is an exciting prospect who has already created a position for himself to lead the champion cricketers in the team. Root also expressed his excitement to play with the RR team and to work closely with players like Ashwin and Riyan Parag.
Root spoke highly of Samson's leadership skills and talent. He believes that Samson has already proven his worth as a player and as a leader. Under Samson's leadership, the RR team reached the finals in the previous edition of the IPL, and many believe that they have the best team in the tournament this year.

item.title: BCCI Introduces Special Device to Monitor Players' Fatigue in IPL
item.description:
BCCI Introduces Special Device to Monitor Players' Fatigue in IPL
The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has introduced a special device to monitor the players' fatigue during the Indian Premier League (IPL). The purpose of this device is to keep a close eye on the workload management of the players, especially those who are expected to represent the country in the upcoming World Test Championship (WTC) final.
The BCCI has been proactive in ensuring that the Indian team performs at their best in the WTC final against New Zealand, which is scheduled to be held in June 2021. To achieve this, the board has taken measures to manage the workload of the players participating in the IPL.

item.title: Matthew Short Joins Punjab Kings; Sandeep Sharma Signed By Rajasthan Royals
item.description: It is officially declared and confirmed that  Matthew Short joined Punjab Kings and Sandeep Sharma is now signed by Rajasthan Royals. Punjab Kings have signed uncapped Australian all-rounder Matthew Short as a replacement for Jonny Bairstow. Also, Fast bowler Sandeep Sharma will represent Rajasthan Royals this season after being signed as a replacement for Prasidh Krishna. Bairstow and Indian fast bowler Prasidh Krishan will not be able to contribute their service to their franchises Punjab Kings and Rajasthan Royals.  The England wicket-keeper batter is ruled out of TATA IPL 2023 as he is yet to fully recover from an injury he sustained in September.  Picked for his base price of INR 50 lakh, Sandeep is one of the most senior bowlers in the tournament with over 100 wickets and 10 seasons of experience under his belt.  It was confirmed in the statement released by the Indian Premier League's official Twitter handle.

Sanju Samson is not in the squad for the ongoing three-match ODI series between India and Australia but former India opener Wasim Jaffer wants the destructive batsman to get a chance in the series decider at Chepauk on Wednesday.

item.title: India's worst defeat in ODI: Australia beat by 10 wickets
item.description: Indian fans will not be able to forget today, even if they want to, India had to face the biggest defeat in ODI history (in terms of wickets and balls left) in Visakhapatnam on Sunday. In the second match of the 3-match ODI series, Australia defeated the Indian team by 10 wickets with 234 balls to spare. The previous record was of 212 balls. Which was made by New Zealand in Hamilton in 2019. The Indian team has lost by 10 wickets for the sixth time in ODIs.

item.title: Kohli's World Record: Became Player of the Match against Australia
item.description:
Kohli's World Record: Became Player of the Match against Australia; The only cricketer to win this award 10+ times in all three formats
Fourth Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy between India and Australia ended in a draw. The last match of the 4 Test series was played in Ahmedabad. India was ahead 2-1 in the series, in such a situation, the series was won by Team India only when the last match was a draw. Virat Kohli played a tremendous inning of 186 runs in 364 balls in this test. He received the Player of the Match award for this innings.

item.title: Kohli's 75th century faster than Sachin: 150+ score for the 16th time.
item.description: Virat Kohli played a marathon inning of 186 off 364 balls against Australia. He batted 520 minutes even after being ill. This is the 28th century of his Test career, which came after 1205 days.

item.title: New Zealand announced team for T20 series against India
item.description: The New Zealand board has announced the team for the T20 series against India, India has not yet announced its team for the New Zealand series, Limited overs captain Kane Williamson and Test captain Tim Southee will not be part of the series. Left arm spinner Mitchell Santner will captain in the absence of both. The series of 3 T20 matches will start from 27 January.

item.title: Mumbai VS UP in Women's Premier League today
item.description:
Mumbai V/S UP in Women's Premier League today :MI have won all their matches in the tournament
Today in the Women's Premier League, a match will be played between Mumbai Indians and UP Warriors. The match will start at 7:30 pm at the Brabourne Stadium. Mumbai Indians have not lost a single match in the tournament so far. They are also on top of the points table with 6 points from 3 matches. While Warriors have won 2 out of 3 matches, they are at number three in the points table with 4 points.

item.title: India-Australia Test, Day 4
item.description: India-Australia Test, Day 4: Virat's century after 1205 days, 23 Tests and 41 innings

item.title: India 289-3 in the first innings
item.description:
India 289/3 in the first innings after 14 months and 15 innings, Kohli's Fifty, Gill scored his 5th century of the year
India has given a befitting reply to Australia in the fourth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. The team has scored 289 runs for three wickets in response to Australia's 480 runs in the first innings. India is still behind by 191 runs. After the end of Saturday's game on the third day of the match, Virat Kohli returned unbeaten on 59 and Ravindra Jadeja on 16 runs.

item.title: Delhi Capitals won by 10 wickets in WPL
item.description:
Delhi Capitals won by 10 wickets in WPL
In the Women's Premier League (WPL), Delhi Capitals defeated Gujarat Giants by 10 wickets. Electing to bat after winning the toss at the DY Patil Stadium, Gujarat scored 105 runs for the loss of 9 wickets in 20 overs. In response, the Capitals achieved the target in 7.1 overs without losing wickets.

item.description:
India-Australia 4th Test in Ahmedabad: Team India reached WTC final after winning
The fourth and final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy between India and Australia will be played from tomorrow. The match will begin at 9:30 am on Thursday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. The last match of the Test series is very important for both the countries. India is currently leading 2-1 in the series. On winning the fourth Test, the team will win the series and also enter the final of the World Test Championship. Where the team will face Australia only.

item.description:

Delhi Capitals will face Mumbai Indians today in the Women's Premier League (WPL). Both the teams have not lost a single match in the tournament so far. Where Mumbai beat Bengaluru and Gujarat. At the same time, Delhi won over UP and Bengaluru. Delhi will be captained by Australia's Meg Lanning, while Mumbai's command is in the hands of Harmanpreet Kaur.

item.description: The third ODI BANGLADESH vs ENGLAND, Bangladesh win by 50 runs. This win from Shakib 360-degree performance, Shakib firstly make a 75 run and also performed in bolling, out the 4 England batsman He was awarded the Player of the Match for this performance. Bangladesh won the toss and elected to bat first in Chattogram and were all out for 246 in 48.5 overs.

item.description: Today in the Women's Premier League (WPL), a match will be played between Delhi Capitals and UP Warriors. The match will start at 7:30 pm at DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai. Both the teams won their first matches. While Delhi beat Bengaluru by 60 runs, UP registered a 3-wicket win over Gujarat in a thrilling encounter.

The match will be played at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. Under the captaincy of Harmanpreet Kaur, Mumbai Indians won their first match against Gujarat. On the other hand, Smriti Mandhana's team Royal Challengers Bangalore had to start with a defeat.

item.title: Pat Cummins will not even play the fourth Test
item.description:
Pat Cummins will not even play the fourth Test
Australia's Test captain Pat Cummins has been ruled out of the last Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy. At the same time, Jhye Richardson, who joined the team for the ODI series to be held after the Test, has also been ruled out of the team due to injury. , , Actually the health of Cummins's mother is bad. Because of this, he returned to Australia only after the Delhi Test. He was supposed to come before the third Test but has now decided to stay back with his family in Australia.

item.description: Rest of India (ROI) captained by Mayank Agarwal has won the Irani Trophy. The team defeated Madhya Pradesh by a huge margin of 238 runs in the final match. Mumbai's top order batsman Yashasvi Jaiswal was the hero of this victory.

item.description: Today is the first double header-day of the first WPL. The first match of Sunday will be played between Royal Challengers Bangalore and Delhi Capitals at Brabourne Stadium from 3:30 pm. After that, the teams of UP Warriors and Gujarat Giants will show their mettle at DY Patil Stadium from 7:30 pm.

item.title: ICC described Indore pitch as poor
item.description:
ICC described Indore pitch as 'poor': 16 wickets fell on the first day of the third Test, 14 wickets on the second day.
The third Test played between India and Australia at the Holkar Stadium in Indore ended on the third day itself. The game of 15 sessions could last only for 7 sessions. 31 wickets fell in the match, out of which 26 were taken by the spinners. After which the International Cricket Council (ICC) has given the pitch of the stadium 'Poor' bad rating.

The tournament will begin on Saturday evening at 7:30 pm with the match between Gujarat Giants and Mumbai Indians at the DY Patil Stadium. All 22 matches of the competition will be played at DY Patil and Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai.

item.description:
Women's T20 World Cup Final AUS vs SA
Final match of the Women's T20 World Cup will begin shortly between South Africa vs Australia. Australia won the toss and decided to bat first at the Newlands ground in Cape Town (south Africa). South Africa has reached the final of a World Cup for the first time. At the same time, the Australia team has won this tournament 5 times.

With this victory, the Indian team will secure its place in the final of the World Test Championship.

item.title: South Africa in the final of the Women's T20 World Cup for the first time: beat England by 6 runs
item.description:
South Africa in the final of the Women's T20 World Cup for the first time: beat England by 6 runs
Host South Africa has entered the final of the Women's T20 World Cup. The team defeated England by 6 runs in a thrilling semi-final. The African team has reached the final for the first time. On Sunday, South Africa will face the 5-time world champion Australian team, who defeated India by 5 runs a day earlier. Needing 13 runs from the last over, the English team needed 13 runs to win at the Newlands ground in Cape Town, but the pair of Sarah Glenn and Charlotte Dean could only manage 6 runs in the over of Shabnim Ismail.

Australia's ODI squad against India released: Glenn Maxwell and Mitchell Marsh return to the team.
Australia has announced the team for the ODI series against India to be held on March 17. The Australia Cricket Board informed about this on Thursday. Glenn Maxwell and Mitchell Marsh have returned to the Australian team after a long time. Maxwell was injured after the T20 World Cup in November. He had slipped at a birthday party and hurt his leg. At the same time, Marsh was out of the team for a long time due to a left ankle injury.

The women's Indian team has entered the semi-finals of the ongoing Women's T20 World Cup in South Africa. The Indian team, captained by Harmanpreet Kaur, defeated Ireland by 5 runs under the Duckworth-Lewis (DLS) method in their last match in Group-2 on Monday.

Team India has won the Border-Gavaskar Trophy for the fourth time in a row. India beat Australia by 6 wickets on the third day of the Delhi Test to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series. With this, it was decided to retain India's occupation of BGT.

item.description:
Women's T20 World Cup, Australia beat South Africa to reach semi-finals; Yesterday, England beat India by 11 runs; It is necessary to win the next match for the semi-finals

Batting first, South Africa scored 124 runs losing 6 wickets in the match held at Cabra late on Saturday night. In response, Australia chased the target in 16.3 overs. Tahila McGrath of Australia played a half-century innings. He scored 57 runs in 33 balls.

item.description: India will face England today in the Women's T20 World Cup. The match will start at 6:30 pm in Kebera, South Africa. item.description: Team India will play the first Test match of 2023 against Australia from tomorrow. The first of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy between Australia and India in Nagpur will start at 9:30 am on Thursday. It is going to be important for both the teams. On one hand, there is pressure on India to reach number one position in the Test rankings. At the same time, Australia would also like to win the series in India after 19 years.

item.title: Aaron Finch retired from international cricket
item.description: Australia's T20 captain Aaron Finch retired from international cricket on Tuesday. Finch had retired from ODIs last year. Now he has taken retirement from T20 as well. Finch was part of Australia's 2021 T20 World Cup winning team. Finch is also Australia's highest run scorer in T20.

item.title: Ravindra Jadeja said happy to wear India jersey after 5 months
item.description: Indian cricket team all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has joined the Indian team. He will be a part of Team India in the Test series against Australia starting on 9 February. Before the Test match, BCCI shared the video of Ravindra Jadeja's interview. In this, he shared his post-surgery rehab experience.

item.title: First biggest Test of Rohit Sharma's captaincy career
item.description: The 4-match series against Australia will be the biggest Test of Rohit Sharma's captaincy. The first Test will be played in Nagpur from 9 February. After captaincy in February 2022, Rohit could captain India in only 2 Tests. Meanwhile, due to injury, he could not play 3 Tests in England and Bangladesh. Rohit has little experience in Test captaincy. At the same time, the series is very important for India to reach the final of the World Test Championship.

item.title: Australia's Steve Smith and David Warner Gear Up for Epic Test Series Against India
item.description:
"Australia's Steve Smith and David Warner Gear Up for Epic Test Series Against India: Breaking India's 19-Year Win Streak in Focus"
Before the upcoming Test series between India and Australia starting on 9th January, the players of the Australian cricket team expressed the importance of the series in a video released by Cricket Australia. Steve Smith stated that beating India on their home ground is more significant than winning the Ashes in England. David Warner mentioned that facing India's skilled spinners is always a challenge. Fast bowler Mitchell Starc referred to the series as special, considering the differing conditions in India and the strength of the home team. Australia has not won a Test series in India since 2004 and will play 4 Tests and 3 ODIs during this visit. The first Test will be held in Nagpur followed by Delhi, Dharamshala, and Ahmedabad.

item.title: Team India starts a practice in Nagpur
item.description: Team India has started practice before the Border-Gavaskar Test series against Australia. All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, who was out of the team for 6 months due to injury, took batting practice. At the same time, 6 domestic spinners have been included in the training camp to prepare for the spin track.  The Indian team will prepare in Nagpur from February 3 to 6. Where the first Test is to be played from 9 February. The Australia team is practicing in Alur, Bangalore. The team will come to Nagpur on 7 February.

item.title: Pakistan will once again bow before India! Asia Cup hosting will be snatched?
item.description: The emergency meeting of the Asian Cricket Council (ACC) is to be held today to host the Asia Cup 2023. The meeting will be held in Bahrain, in which ACC President Jai Shah will also be involved. In this meeting, a decision can be taken to shift the Asia Cup from Pakistan to some other country.

item.title: Fast bowler Joginder Sharma announced his retirement
item.description: Fast bowler Joginder Sharma, who was part of India's T20 World Cup winning cricket team in the year 2007, has said goodbye to cricket today. Joginder Sharma is serving as DSP in Ambala Police these days.

item.title: Women's IPL being a super hit in the first season
item.description: Preparations for the first Women's Premier League have started from the Board of Control for Cricket in India, in which there has been no lack of excitement so far. Not only this, players from all over the world are showing their interest to participate in this first women's T20 league of Indian cricket, in which about 1000 players have registered. The auction for women players will be held in Mumbai on February 13, before which the franchises will be seen narrowing down the list.

item.description: Women's T20 World Cup will be held from February 10 Last time this tournament was held in Australia.

item.description: Good news has come for the Indian team and its fans ahead of the 4-match Test series to be played between India and Australia from February 9. Indian team's fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah, who was away from the field due to injury for a long time, is now fully fit and is ready to return to the field once again. Jasprit Bumrah will join the Indian team in the third match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy to be played against Australia. At present, Jasprit Bumrah has returned to the nets.

item.title: Murali Vijay announces retirement from all forms of international cricket
item.description: Veteran India opener Murali Vijay on Monday announced his retirement from all forms of international cricket. He tweeted, 'Today with immense gratitude and humility, I announce my retirement from all forms of international cricket. My journey from 2002-2018 has been the best year of my life as it was an honor to represent India at the highest level of the game. I am grateful for the opportunities given to me by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI), Tamil Nadu Cricket Association (TNCA), Chennai Super Kings, and Chemplast Sanmar.

item.title: Women's IPL: Delhi, Mumbai, Ahmedabad, Bangalore and Lucknow Teams will play
item.description: Women’s IPL5 teams have been auctioned. On Wednesday, the board announced the names of the successful companies in the auction. The board will get a total amount of Rs 4669.99 crore from this auction. The highest bid is for the Ahmedabad franchise. In lieu of this franchise, Adani Group will give Rs 1289 crore to the board.

item.title: Suryakumar Yadav is the ICC Men’s T20I Player of Year
item.description: India's explosive batsman Suryakumar Yadav has become the ICC Men's T20 Player of the Year. He has become the first Indian batsman to achieve this position. The International Cricket Council (ICC) made this announcement on Wednesday. English batsman Sam Curran, Pakistani wicketkeeper Mohammad Rizwan and Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza were also among the contenders for this ICC title.

item.title: Siraj became the world's number-1 ODI bowler
item.description: Another good news has come to the fore for Indian cricket fans in two days. Team India became the world's No. 1 ODI team on Tuesday by a 3-0 clean sweep against New Zealand. Today India's Mohammad Siraj has become the number-1 ODI bowler in the world. In the latest rankings released on Wednesday, Siraj reached the first position with 729 points. Australia's Josh Hazlewood (727 points) is in second place and New Zealand's Trent Boult (708 points) is in third place.

item.title: Many records made in the third ODI against New Zealand
item.description: Team India defeated New Zealand by 90 runs in the third ODI to clean sweep the series 3-0. In this match held at Indore's Holkar Stadium, Indian opener Shubman Gill, captain Rohit Sharma and the entire team made many big records more than one.

International Cricket Council (ICC)
item.description: The International Cricket Council (ICC) is the international governing body of cricket. It was founded in 1909 as the Imperial Cricket Conference and later renamed to the International Cricket Conference in 1965, before being renamed to its current name in 1989. The ICC is responsible for the organization and governance of cricket's major international tournaments, including the Cricket World Cup, the ICC World Twenty20, and the ICC Champions Trophy.

item.description: The Cricket Asia Cup 2023 is set to be one of the biggest cricket tournaments in the region, featuring some of the top teams from Asia. item.title: ODI World Cup 2023
item.description: The 2023 Cricket World Cup is set to be one of the most highly anticipated events in the world of cricket. Scheduled to be held in India, it will be the 13th edition of the tournament and the fifth time that India will be hosting the World Cup. The tournament is set to take place between September and October 2023 and will feature a single group of 10 teams, with each team playing the other nine teams, and the top four teams progressing to the semi-finals. The ICC (International Cricket Council) has not yet officially announced the venues for the tournament, but it is expected that some of the biggest and most iconic cricket grounds in India will be chosen to host the matches. The World Cup is the pinnacle of one-day cricket and is contested by the top teams from around the world. The tournament is widely considered to be the second most important event in the world of cricket after the ICC Test Championship. The 2023 World Cup will be the first tournament to be held under the new format which was adopted by the ICC in 2019. The new format will see the top 10 teams in the world competing in a single group, with each team playing the other nine teams. The top four teams will then progress to the semi-finals, with the winners of those matches progressing to the final. This format is designed to make the tournament more competitive and exciting, as it will ensure that all teams have a chance to qualify for the semi-finals, regardless of their ranking. The teams that are expected to compete in the 2023 World Cup are the top 10 teams in the ICC ODI rankings as of September 2022. These teams are India, England, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, Pakistan, Bangladesh, West Indies, Sri Lanka, and Afghanistan. These teams are all expected to field strong sides and will be looking to make a statement in the tournament. India has a strong team with a mix of experience and youth, and they have been performing well in recent years. They will be looking to win their third World Cup title and will be playing in front of their home crowd, which will give them a significant advantage. England is another team that is expected to perform well in the 2023 World Cup. They have a strong team and have been performing well in recent years, winning the 2019 World Cup. They will be looking to defend their title and win their second World Cup title. Australia is another team that is expected to perform well in the 2023 World Cup. They have a strong team and have been performing well in recent years. They will be looking to win their sixth World Cup title and will be looking to make a statement in the tournament. New Zealand, South Africa, Pakistan, Bangladesh, West Indies, Sri Lanka, and Afghanistan are other teams that are expected to compete in the tournament. These teams are all expected to field strong sides and will be looking to make a statement in the tournament. In conclusion, the 2023 Cricket World Cup is set to be one of the most highly anticipated events in the world of cricket. Scheduled to be held in India, it will be the 13th edition of the tournament and the fifth time that India will be hosting the World Cup. The tournament is set to take place between September and October 2023 and will feature a single group of 10 teams, with each team playing the other nine teams, and the top four teams progressing to the semi-finals. With the likes of India, England, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, Pakistan, Bangladesh, West Indies, Sri Lanka, and Afghanistan expected to compete, it's sure to be a tournament filled with exciting cricket, drama, and tension

item.title: Grand match between India and Pakistan
item.description:
President of the American Cricket Board claims – there will be a big fight in the 2024 T20 World Cup.
ICC conducts at least one India-Pakistan match in each of its tournaments. These two arch-rivals will also clash in the 2024 T20 World Cup. This World Cup is to be jointly hosted by West Indies and America. American Cricket Board President Atul Rai has claimed that India-Pakistan match will be held in America and not in West Indies. Rai has said in an interview, 'India-West Indies match in Florida got excellent response from the local fans. All the tickets for the match were sold out. Therefore, we feel that if the India-Pakistan World Cup match is also held in America, it will get tremendous support from the fans. In August last year, India toured West Indies and America. During this, Team India played 5 T20 and three ODI series. The last T20 was played in Florida, which India won by 88 runs. Team India had named this T20 series 4-1.

item.description: Shubman Gill hit his second ODI century in the final ODI of the three-match series between India and Sri Lanka on Sunday. Gill scored his first century of 2023 and his third international hundred in just 89 balls. He hit 11 fours and two sixes in his brilliant performance to reach his hundred.

item.description: Virat Kohli scored his third ODI century in 4 innings, 74th overall (166*), this is Kohli's third ODI century in four matches, the last two coming against Sri Lanka and Bangladesh respectively.

item.title: Team India announced for against New Zealand and the first two tests Australia
item.description:
The BCCI on Friday announced Team India for the home series against New Zealand and the first two Tests against Australia.
The Indian team will play a series of 3 ODIs and 3 T20 matches against New Zealand in the end of January. After that, the series of 4 Test matches against Australia will start from 9 February. After the Test series, the team also has to play 3 ODIs against the Australia. Ishaan Kishan and KS Bharat have been given a chance in place of Rahul in the ODI team. While Prithvi Shaw has been included in the team in T20. Apart from this, Suryakumar Yadav has been included in the squad for the opening two Tests against Australia. Indian team against New Zealand

item.title: I enjoy being given different challenges: KL Rahul
item.description: The 30-year-old, who is a regular Test opener, has donned wicket-keeping gloves in white-ball cricket and has been used as a floater in the batting order. But the Karnataka player has no complaints and said he is enjoying the challenges. Not many can adjust to the variety of roles KL Rahul has been asked to play over the years.

item.title: WOMEN IPL 2023
item.description: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) can release the names of 5 teams of Women's IPL on January 25. BCCI sources said, it is not necessary that only the highest bidder franchise will be given the team. The decision will also be taken keeping in view the future and growth of women players, Priority will be given to the highest bidder. If two franchises place equal bids for a team, both will be asked to bid again. Even then, in case of a tie, the BCCI will take the final call to select the team.

item.title: INDIA: great chance to win continuously 10th cricket match series Against Sri Lanka
item.description: The second match of the India-Sri Lanka ODI series will be played at Eden Gardens ground in Kolkata from 1:30 pm today. The Indian team has not lost to Sri Lanka in the ODI series for the last 26 years. His last lose the match was in 1997.

item.title: India-Sri Lanka 2nd ODI: Sri Lanka ahead of Indian spinners
item.description:
Sri Lankan team limited to 215, Kuldeep-Siraj took 3-3 wickets. Sri Lanka has given India a target of 216 runs in the second match of the ODI series.
The second match of the India-Sri Lanka ODI series is being played today at the Eden Gardens ground in Kolkata. Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka has won the toss and choose to bat first, in this match, The Indian team is ahead 1-0 in the series after winning the first ODI in Guwahati. By winning this match, he will be eyeing an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series. There has been a change in India's playing-11. Leg spinner Yuzvendra Chahal is not fully fit. Kuldeep Yadav has been given a chance in his place. From Sri Lanka Team, Nuwanidu Fernando, playing debut match, scored the first international half-century. He completed 63 runs in the half-century. His innings included 6 fours. India have dominated the middle-overs phase quite elegantly and will look at ending Sri Lanka's innings soon enough. In this match, Team India will have a chance to win the 10th consecutive ODI series against Sri Lanka. The Indian team has not lost to Sri Lanka in the ODI series for the last 26 years. His last defeat was in 1997.

item.title: The way he plays reminds me of Vivian Richards: Former Australia star heaps praise on Suryakumar
item.description: Team India started the new year with a bang and won the ODI series by defeating Sri Lanka 2-1 in the three-match T20I series. One of India's most consistent batsmen in T20s was Suryakumar Yadav, who looks to be in a league of his own in the shortest format of the game. The World No. 1 T20I player scored 51 and 112* in the 2nd and 3rd T20Is respectively; The three-figure mark was Suryakumar's second in the format as he continues to terrorize bowlers in T20Is.

item.title: Prithvi Shaw's first triple century in Ranji Trophy 2022-23
item.description: Prithvi Shaw scored his first triple century in the Mumbai Ranji's team career. He played an inning of 379 runs in 383 balls. This is the second-highest innings in Ranji Trophy history. Before him, Bibi Nimbalkar scored an unbeaten 443 for Maharashtra in the 1948-49 season. continues to hold the record for the highest Ranji Trophy score and the highest first-class score by an Indian batter, Prithvi Shaw's best score in our cricket carrier in Ranji  Trophy, had scored 202 against Baroda in the 2019-20 Ranji Season.

item.title: Naseem Shan Removes Finn Allen As New Zealand Lose Early Wicket
item.description: In the NZ v/s PAK 2nd ODI of the three-match series at the National Stadium in Karachi, New Zealand won the toss and opted to bat first against Pakistan. Ish Sodhi returned to the playing XI after missing the series opener and replaced Henry Shipley. Pakistan, on the other hand, names an unchanged side. The hosts had won the first match of the series by six wickets and will now be eyeing a series win against a poor home crowd. Chasing a target of 256, Pakistan crossed the finish line with 11 balls to spare thanks to half-centuries from Mohammad Rizwan (77 not out), Babar Azam (66), and Fakhar Zaman (56). New Zealand will be hoping for a better performance this time around as they look to stage a comeback and force a series decider.

item.title: Sri Lanka's target of 374 runs
item.description: Team India has given Sri Lanka a target of 374 runs in the first match of the ODI series on the basis of a century by Virat Kohli (113 runs off 87 balls). India scored 373 runs for 7 wickets in 50 overs.

item.title: BCCI HQ was inundated with calls from fans to know Rishabh Pant's condition after his accident.
item.description: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) headquarters has been receiving constant calls from fans of Cricketer Rishabh Pant who recently got injured in a car accident on Friday morning. They are seeking an update on the wicket-keeper batsman and want to know whether his injury is serious when he will recover, or whether he will play the home Test series against Australia.
